bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Herbert Putnam to Laura Armistead Carter, October 5, 1928

div1.p: Putnam requests that Carter return a book that she checked out of the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Herbert Putnam to Laura Armistead Carter, October 5, 1928
div1.opener:
Book, Misel
Library of Congress
LP
R. R. Form I
LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
READING ROOM
WASHINGTON
All correspondence should be addressed
“LIBRARIAN OF CONGRESS
WASHINGTON, D. C.”
IN REPLY QUOTE FILE NO. RR
October 5th 1928
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
Unless our records are in error, the books listed below* have been
in your possession for more than one month. If you have concluded
your use of them, we shall be glad to have you return them as soon as
possible.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, HERBERT PUTNAM Librarian of Congress
By [unclear]
Superintendent of Reading Room
*July 3, 1928 Brinton - Maya Chronicles
Miss L. A. Carter,
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St.,
Washington, D C
Mem. Taken out
Sept. 19/28
Returned Oct 5/28
i.e. in my possession less than 1 month
L A C.
